Feel free to use one of our boats to return to the surface when your business here is concluded. It will take you to a beach not far from Cierzo.
Welcome. Bow your head in respect, for you have come to the end of a Ley Line. The place where the very world itself will pour its power into you, if you make room for it.
To open yourself to Mana is to open yourself to the flow of our world. To use magic is to command the world to obey your desires. Master magic, and you master the flow that echoes through us all.
If you are prepared to sacrifice some of yourself for it, and you are prepared to miss many nights of sleep, we welcome you. May the power of Mana lead you on the road to success.
Hold up there, [PlayerName]! Where do you think you’re going?
I’m going outside.
Not like that you aren't! You need at least an equipped weapon, a waterskin and an equipped backpack before you're ready to face the outside world.
If I let you adventure outside without even the most basic of equipment, you'd be marching to your own death!
If you're pressed to find a weapon, make yourself a quarterstaff from some tree wood. You can also craft a backpack, although I'm sure you have one lying around at home.
But I need to get out! My life depends on it!
Alright. I'll make sure I'm prepared before I head out.
And I can't let you out in this state. Your life also depends on it!

Come back when you're seriously ready. And don't even think about using the storage tunnel under the lighthouse to sneak out! There's a pair of Troglodytes in there that we haven't had time to put down!
I'm also sure you can find a spare waterskin by the Water Purifier at the town beach. Don't forget to fill it up while you're there!
What can you tell me about the Chersonese Region?
There's several packs of hyenas to the north that are muscling into our hunting grounds. There are some nasty Troglodytes in the area too. I suspect they're jockeying for territory and prey.
Stay far away from the north-east in particular. I've heard rumors of a Scourge Beast, a shell horror specifically, near the Ghost Pass. It’s probably just a rumor, but better safe than sorry, I say.
Don't forget that two other tribes are in open hostility to us right now. Be wary of the Montcalm tribe in the north and the Kazite pirates near the coast.
Then there's the matter of several bandit crews deciding to join forces in the Vendavel fortress along the southern coast. Stay well away from it. They will enslave you if they capture you.
What are you up to, Warden?
Waiting on some scouts to come back from reconnaissance. Up to date information on what’s happening in the surrounding region is essential to keeping Cierzo safe.
There's a bandit group I suspect is planning to attack us, and I want us to be prepared. I may be a skilled warrior, but against two dozen foes even I would be swept aside.
My warriors and I are the last line of defense for Cierzo. We decide what enters and what is driven from our walls. We bear the heaviest responsibility in this tribe.
Well, you’ve got the essentials at least. Here, I'll teach you a skill. Mastering these is the key to survival out in the wild. Want me to teach you one for the weapon you’re currently holding?

There you go! Mastering skills like this one is the key to survival out in the wild. You should look for Trainers whenever you visit a new town. They usually group near training equipment. Others need to be sought out.
I think I want to learn one for a different weapon, give me a minute Burac.
Alright, I’ll let you go outside the town’s walls. Use the gate whenever you want to head out. Stay safe out there.
value
Ah, [PlayerName], I am glad that you're back. We need all the help we can get. The Fortress of Vendavel has become a threat we can't ignore!
I hope I can count on your help dealing with the fortress of Vendavel. It remains a deadly threat to Cierzo.

When it was just squatting bandits, it was bad enough. Now we know that 3 warlords have begun to order them into an army. I think they mean to attack Cierzo. If they do... I don't know if we can hold them off.
What do you recommend we do?
I honestly don't know. If we send any kind of force to go attack the fortress, we risk stirring the hornet's nest…If only if we could separate and deal with the Warlords one at a time...
It would be very dangerous to infiltrate the fortress. Use discretion and caution. Messing with Vendavel might get you imprisoned, enslaved, or worse.
Do you know who is organizing them?
I’ll take care of it.
One is a former warrior of mine, Crock. Exiled after he murdered two of my men in a drunken brawl. Another is a Kazite pirate captain even Eto is wary about... I think they know each other.
And lastly, there’s a mage who used to be part of one of Harmattan’s tribes. All 3 of them need to be dealt with. If you have to, kill them. They’re that much of a threat.
My men tell me that Vendavel has gotten a lot quieter. I don’t want to think about the disaster that would have hit! On behalf of all of Cierzo, I thank you.

Say, you were the one who sent Crock out here to challenge me, weren't you? Very smart move. A single drunkard like that was no threat to me. I’ve locked him in a cell below the town hall. Once Rissa comes back, we’ll decide what to do with him.
My men tell me that Vendavel has gotten a lot quieter. On behalf of all of Cierzo, I thank you. I do not want to think about the disaster what would have hit us if you hadn’t!
Remember that the Fortress of Vendavel is a threat to the very existence of Cierzo. Be careful, [PlayerName].
And what did you want to talk about?
I want to talk about Vendavel.
I want to talk about your work and the Chersonese in general.
What do you want to know?
Here, I feel I can trust you with the key to Cierzo. It’ll open up anything you like in town, including the vault in the Chamberlady’s town hall.

Amba, friend [PlayerName]. The threat of the Vendavel has me very worried. I would go to take care of them, but... I think one of those warlords, the Kazite... I think I know who it is. He would recognize me and kill me before I even got inside.
I want to do something about Vendavel too, where is it?
It's the old fortress on the beach to the south-west of the Chersonese.
Is there a safe way to get inside?

I think so... Bring me 3 iron scraps and some Blue Sand and I can modify one of my Kazite masks to fit you. If you cover your face with it, and say the right words, you may convince the gatekeepers that you are one of them.
I found what you’ll need to modify the mask, Eto.
Ah! Perfect. Wait for a moment, it will not take long.

It should fit you now. Make sure you wear this before you try to talk to the guards. If he is a Kazite pirate too, it is important to greet him with the word “Nindiria”. It roughly means sea-brother. And try to speak like me, yes?
About the warlord you said you know in Vendavel...
Yes? You have news of him?
It’s your uncle... He said he is only attacking Cierzo to get revenge. If you turn yourself in to him right away, he will leave Cierzo alone for good.
AIE! I knew it... That Nanzome... That Black Heart... He would kill so many just to punish me? Then, if my life will buy the lives of all of Cierzo, I will give it to him.
Don’t go, I’ll kill the bastard myself. Just stay safe until then.
I’m sorry, Eto...
Do not be. Actions always have consequences. I knew this may happen the moment I took up my sword against him. But I have no regrets. It was good to know you, [PlayerName]. Take care of yourself.
It's... Nevermind.
You were wrong, no one there knows you. It's safe for you to sneak in.
You are... sure? I trust you, [PlayerName]. If you say it is safe, then I will go infiltrate the fortress. I will see you very soon, with the warlords here in chains!
If you think you can stop him... then I will stay here. Cejo murio tapame amba. Best of luck, my friend.
Amba, friend [PlayerName]! I heard you destroyed the warlords of Vendavel! Perhaps I should call you the champion of Cierzo, now!
Yes, if you wear a mask like a Kazite, and say the right words, you should be able to pretend that you are one of them.
Do you know a Mage named Balira? I'm looking for her husband.

I know her, she was an apprentice of mine. Then, she twisted the gifts of the Five Winds to perform forbidden and horrible magic. Manipulating a person's Inside Wind, no matter the reason, is a violation of a person's most sacred boundary.
I told her she was never to come here again after what she did. And yet... although I cannot forgive her sacrilege, it's time to set aside this tragedy.

The man... or rather, what's left of the man you're looking for is hiding in the old broken tombs within this valley. He, or rather, "it" lives in the frozen cavern at the mouth of it. Put an end to its misery, and break their connection.
You’re not one of my warriors... You’re from Ciezo, I can tell. Make your case quickly, before I decide to have you locked up with the others!
I'm here to kill you.
I'd like to see you try. Attack the intruder, men!
I want you to call off your war against Cierzo.

Why should I do that? Cierzo bears some responsibility for what happened to me. Although... there is one thing you can do that could make me reconsider. I need you to kill someone for me. My former husband.
I’m not killing a man I don’t know.
Go on.

My mother arranged our marriage when I was young, she said it would benefit both our own tribe and Cierzo. He was... cruel when no one looked, and seemed incapable of realizing the harm he caused. In an attempt to make him understand, I tried something drastic.

I used magic I learned from the Cabal of Winds to twist our Inside Winds, our spirits, together. It only made things worse. He could sense my fear of him, and it drove him mad. He set fire to our home and fled into the night.
Because our spirits are still twisted together, if he senses me coming to find him, he will flee from me. I need someone else to put him down and end this horrid bond between us.
Where do I start looking?
The bastard’s hiding in the Chersonese, in the valley beyond Ghost Pass. He’s made his den in the Corrupted Tombs. I can sense cold ice all around him.
Track him down and kill him. He's nothing but a monster now, in every sense of the word. His nightmarish thoughts haunt me even now.
I can sense my late husband's Mana clinging to your very skin, and his monstrous thoughts no longer fill my dreams. Thank you. Tell me, what had happened to him?
He had become a Wendigo.
I thought as much. Thank you for ending this nightmare. Cierzo has repaid its debt to me. I no longer have a quarrel with them.
Begone, we have no further business.
Then you’re a trespasser. Guards! To prison with this one!
You are not one of mine. I can tell. You’re no Kazite pirate. What makes you dare to stand before Rospa Akiyuki?
Who are you, and why do you dare stand before Rospa Akiyuki?

Aho! You care for that bundle of huts, do you? Maybe I'll make you watch as I burn it to the ground. My Nanzome of a nephew betrayed us for those land-loving ghost-men. So long as Eto Akiyuki lives, my fury will know no quiet.

You want me to call off the destruction of Cierzo? Then bring that Nanzome, that black heart traitor, to me. Give me Eto’s life, and I will give you the lives of the worthless ash-faces in that tiny village!
If you agree, I will let you leave to bring him here. Send him here within 1 day, or I will make you pay!
There's no way I'd make that deal.
Then you will only be useful to me as a slave!
Eto's life for the lives of everyone in Cierzo? That's not a bad deal.
Good. Then, I will let you go. Remember, send Eto here within one day, or else!
Hyah, you think you can mess with Rospa Akiyuki? Then you die. ARCHERS! Fill him with arrows until his blood stains the floor!

Ah, Amba, my nandipame friend. You brought me Eto's head. I made him pay. I made him scream. I am no Nanzome, I honor my word and my bonds. I have no love for Cierzo, but I will spare it even so. My fury is satisfied... For now.
Why do you remain? I am no Nanzome, like Eto. My Kazite honor is solid like stone. I have no business against Cierzo... for now.
Nothing, I’m sorry I bothered you.
You can’t just go where you don’t belong and walk away. You either come quietly, or I beat you until you nandipame and arimbome!
I’m sorry, I’ll take care of it.
I’ve changed my mind, I’m not going to let you kill Eto.
You came back without Eto! My patience is very thin! You come back to prisons quietly, or I will take out my fury for Eto on you!
I’ll come quietly.
Not today!
Well now, what do we have here? A lost traveller? Come, warm yourself up inside! We'll take good care of you!
I'm just passing by.
What? But we have everything you need inside! We have food, water and treasure! Come on in!
Sure, sounds good.
Good, follow me and behave yourself. We could always use more people to handle our work...
I'll pass, thanks.
No, no, I think you’re sick! You need to see our medic right away! I insist!
I’m looking for a place to rest for a while.
Then you’ve come to the right place! We have plenty of free rooms for weary travellers!
Just looking for someone to have a drink with.
Ah, someone who speaks my language! What do you have for us to drink?
Just some water, sadly.
Tea, obviously.
Uhh... Nothing, I was hoping you'd offer me a drink.
Bah, we have plenty swill inside. Say, why don't I show you? Come inside with me and I’ll show you!
Oh. Well, sure! We have plenty of things to drink here, come with me and I'll show you!
I have a bottle of Gaberry Wine, actually.
*sniff* *sniff* Oh this smells like the good stuff.
R'oh man that was the best booze I've had in... well, since being exiled. I feel like I could take on anyone and win!
Anyone? Even me?
HAH! Challenge accepted! Let's get bloody, friend!
Anyone? Even someone like Burac, the warden of Cierzo?
That damn Burac, kicking me out like he did... When we come attack Cierzo, I'm gonna get 'im and put his head on a plaque! He can’t stop a whole army!
Why wait? Clearly you're a match for him alone, right?
Yeah... you’re right! Here, hold the fort while I’m gone! JUST YOU WAIT BURAC! I'M COMING FOR YOU!
No, I don’t wanna! And I wanna headbutt your head into the wall for even sayin' that!
Well, I'll be on my way.
Awww... So soon? Alright, you just come back when you have more of this stuff, it's real good!
Oh good, the entertainment has arrived. Put 'em up, you little twig!
Hey, wait a minute... I remember you, what are you doing back here?
I’m feelin’ a little too drunk right now....Ya mind comin’ back some other time?
Help an old lady? I can't stomach those pasty mushroom bars that the cook gives us for food. I haven't had egg in forever... Can you make me a Miner's Omelet? I’ll reward you for it!
Here, I can teach you how to make it, it's not hard.
I have one for you, enjoy.
Thank you! Here, my day’s silver, and a little something on top.
Thank you for the food, I’m full again! I’ll have the strength to finish my day’s work.
If I find what you need, I’ll be back.
Hey there, get to work! We need to turn in some iron if we want to eat tonight!
I want out of this place!
You want out? Make yourself useful, and maybe, just maybe, the guard'll let you back outside if you pay him well enough.
What do I do down here?

There's plenty of work to do to pass your time. Mine for iron scraps and give them to me, and I'll give you silver for your work. Or you can ask the guard, and if you're nice, he'll let you go help the cook or the medic.
If you make the guards mad at all, you should keep your head down and work hard to make them forget you're a troublemaker. Or else it's “The Hole” for you!
Just don't get in my way when the violence starts.
I won't. I have no interest in being thrown down "The Hole" like everyone else who tries to fight.
You're as bad as the bandits if you're working with them!
Hey now, you won't ever get out of here if you don't play along. People who cause trouble end up down "The Hole".
I’ve dug up some iron scraps, I want to be paid.
Hmm, yeah, this is quality iron. Here, your pay.
Hey, do me a solid and bring me another pickaxe would you? This one’s about to break.
Hey thanks. Here, I found some pearlbird eggs the other day, have one. You need to eat healthy if you wanna survive in here.
I think this one’s going to last for a good day or two. Hopefully I can find enough iron that I buy my way out of this damn pit...
I can't take this place anymore. I want out. I need out. My shiv’s broken... I need a new one. Bring me one and I can show you how to use it. I don’t care if you have to make one, I need one.
Here’s your shiv. What’s your plan?
This is what I need. A promise is a promise. Listen, if you need something from someone here... Backstabbing someone with one of these isn't too hard, here, let me show you...
Now leave me alone. I need to escape.
Hey! Get to work! If you don’t work, you don’t get paid. Without pay, you can’t buy food!
Hah, you want to leave! Aren’t there some errands you can do around here? Be useful to us and we can talk again about your freedom.
Well, I could always use some more coins to buy myself a drink... How much is your freedom worth?
I’ve got 30 silver for you.
I suppose that'll do. Alright, into the sack, prisoner. You'll be carted out hidden with today's corpses. Don't make a peep and you'll get out alive.
I don’t have much money...
Pah, you think that measly pile of silver is going to convince me? Get back to work, slacker, before I discipline you or throw you down “The Hole”! You’re not getting out for anything less than 30!
Is there other work I can do aside from mining?
Yeah, the cook and medic could use a hand. Go on through. But if you put one toe out of line, we'll drag you back here and teach you a lesson.
Let me out or you die.
I love it when you slaves say that. Everyone, gather 'round! Come see what happens if you cause trouble!
I'm hungry.
If you need something to drink, there's a pool of water just over there. Meals are 5 silver. Get to work before you starve!
I’ll pay 5 silver for dinner.
Enjoy your meal, prisoner. If you behave yourself, I can let you into the hallway just outside. Then, you can make your own food in the kitchen and drink clean water from the barrel on the left.
I don't have enough...
Then you'd better get to work, if you don't want to starve.
What are you doing out of the pen, prisoner?
What can I do to help you?
I need someone to cook meals for the warriors. Bring me nine meat stews as soon as humanly possible. Here, the ingredients. Use the stove to my left.
I think I lost the ingredients...
Then you're a thief. Do you know what we do to thieves in here? Guards!
Here are your stews.
Good. Say, you must be hungry. Here, your dinner, prisoner.
We don’t need any more food for today, shoo!
Where are my meat stews?
You’d better have a good excuse, prisoner!
Oy, you. You know how to make bandages, right? We need medical supplies to patch our men up. Bandages or Health Potions will do.
You know how to make them, right? You mix water, Blood Mushroom and a Gravel Beetle. I have a fellow whose life depends on one!
I have a bandage for you.
Good work. Here, you deserve a little pay.
I made the potion for you.
Damn, it’s not bad either. I think you might have saved someone’s life, prisoner. We’re grateful.
Halt, state your business!
Hi, Nindiria. I am back from scouting Cierzo, let me in, yes?
I hope you brought good news. Go make your report to Captain Rospa right away! He has moved to the training room, go left, then right, then up the stairs.
You think I’m stupid, prijpi-brain? I remember you from just a minute ago! You are clearly a spy! Do you know what we do to spies here in Vendavel?
I need to speak with your leaders immediately. I would like to join your crew.
Balira, the mage of winds, will see if you are trustworthy. Go right, then up the stairs and elevator. If you do not impress her, we will find suitable work for you!
I’m just passing by, sorry, I’ll leave.
Taspo, yes, go. Before I change my mind. Forget you saw anything.
Hey! I remember you! You’re that troublemaker! How did you get out of the prison? Guards!
You are not one of us! Get out of here before I lock you up!
(This is “The Hole” that the guards likely toss troublemakers down... You think you can hear the faint sound of water at the bottom.)
(I should be careful not to fall in.)
(Maybe I can jump down this pit to escape!)
Hol’ it right there, [PlayerName]! Some dirty rat has don’ sabotaged our Water Purifier! If you little nipper wanna get some’ to drink, boil that stinkin’ water first!
That lil’ saboteur smashed out the purifier’s Power Coils. Those were some fancy-schmancy magic parts right there! Won’t be able to get my hands on those.
Look, nipper, if ya’ find 2 Power Coils during your big ol’ adventure, can ya bring em’ here? I’ll fix my machine right up, and she’ll be purrin’ and pumpin’ in no time!
I found some Power Coils, Etios. Can you fix the machine?
[PlayerName], you done us good, nipper! It’ll take me a second to get ol’ Bess runnin’ again! And I’ll tinker you a reward with the ol’ coils from the machine.
value
You've been out into the swamp recently, haven't you? I've been waiting on a friend of mine to come from a trip to Harmattan, and he is overdue by several days. Have you seen him along the way?
I don’t think so, what does he look like?
He’s a plain looking missionary, and often wears a hood. I wish I could give you more to go on, but he’s your typical, quiet, unassuming type of person.
He would have come via the Chersonese, so if he’s out in the swamp, he should be taking the Pilgrim Road, and following the glowing sigils. If you find him, please let me know, eh?
Any luck finding my missing friend?
No, nothing yet, sorry.
I found a dead Missionary carrying a letter signed by you.
I found a dead Missionary along the road, but I couldn’t identify them.
Show me the letter... I was afraid of that. Yes, that was him.
Then I can only assume the worst.
Is there anything else you can tell me about the scene of the attack?
It was beside a campsite, with three bedrolls

So, he must have come with two others. I can only hope that at least one of them made it to Monsoon safely. My guess is that his companions were Amalie and Alemmon, both were supposed to come home sometime this month.

Amalie usually comes to talk to me when she returns from a trip abroad... I suspect the only survivor would be Alemmon. He usually holds open magic lessons over in the training district. If he survived, he might be able to tell us what happened.

This is the third time in two months that some of our people have gone missing like this... I begin to worry if there's a conspiracy against the Holy Mission. Bandit attacks are frequent enough, but they usually demand ransom within a few days. This feels far more sinister.
I am trying to gather more information on these attackers, but there is only so much I can do in my old age. 143 years, even with Elatt’s blessing, eventually takes its toll on you.

The occasional scrap against a Tuanosaur as I gather alchemy ingredients, that’s one thing. Combing the marsh for people waiting in ambush is quite another. I hate having to rely on anyone else for this task, but that’s the way it has to be.
Thank you for bringing me news of my friend. I was going to give this to him as a gift for his return. It’s yours, now.
Greetings, are you here to learn the art of magic or philosophy from me?
A group of people was attacked along the Pilgrim Road recently, were you one of them?
Yes, I take it you want to know what happened? I’ve already reported the incident to the Cardinal, but if you want to know, I can tell you.
Yes, talk to me about it.

I was making camp with Jael and Amalie when we were ambushed by several bandits with levantine firearms. Their initial volley caught Jael in the lungs. They demanded we disarm and come with them or suffer the same fate.

They took us up a mountain not too far from the campsite, and... Amalie made a regrettable move. She saw an opening and tried to disarm one of our captors. Things got bloody. We both tumbled into the poisonous swamp water under the mountain cliffs.
I managed to get us both to dry land, but by then the damage was already done. All I could do was close her eyes and make haste for Monsoon.
Mofat said he was concerned this might be a plot against Monsoon.
That would be surprising to me. Yes, this attack was considerably more aggressive than the usual bandit raid, but nothing suggests an actual plot against the Holy Mission.
However, I do agree that something felt off about this group of bandits. They seemed too well-armed to be the usual gang of thugs.
Why do you think you were attacked?

Who knows with these kinds of people. Usually we just get held for ransom, or they let us go once they realize they’ve taken a member of the Holy Mission prisoner. Something did feel off about these ones, though. Too organized.
You said they took you up the mountain near the campsite, right?
Yes, the one off to the west of the campsite, through the root arches. There’s a large network of tunnels under it, burrowed by tree roots. I suspect the criminals set up camp in there.
I think I might go investigate this myself. Thank you for the information.
Elatt watch over you, then. I hope you get to the bottom of this.
One of my friends came back from a pilgrimage to the Chersonese, and saw a gang of Blue Chamber warriors. They’re camping in the old crumbling ruins along the Pilgrim Road.
While I hope they find safety and sanctuary in the Marsh, if they’re here to bring the war to Monsoon, I hope the Cardinal sends a Templar to re-educate them. Hopefully with a quarterstaff.
I’m glad you managed to rescue Oliele. She’s an inquisitive girl, and I’d hate to see her come to harm.

It’s a shame Oliele is still locked up in Lockwell’s home. I saw the incident and can wholeheartedly say it was self-defense. Lockwell’s just doing this to assert some kind of misguided dominance over the Holy Mission.
You’re Oliele’s friend from Cierzo, right? I know where Oliele is. I can’t go, Lockwell’s got one of his thugs stalking me. She’s somewhere in or near the old ruins along the Pilgrim Road.
I’ve seen Lockwell’s house guard around that place often enough, and the night Oliele went missing, he was out of Monsoon. I’d bet a lot of silver she’s out there in those old ruins somewhere.
What’s this about?
(A dead missionary from the Holy Mission lies here. He appears to have been fatally struck by a bullet from a levantine firearm.)
(A dead missionary from the Holy Mission lies here. He appears to have been fatally struck by a bullet from a levantine firearm. This is probably Mofat’s missing friend.)
(He’s carrying a letter in his breast pocket. The bloodstains have ruined most of it, but you think you can see Mofat’s name signed at the bottom. He would want to know what happened here.)
(Sadly, there's nothing more you can do for this man but find his killers and avenge him.)
(You should probably let someone in Monsoon know about this.)

You there! Keep your eyes open in the Marsh. Some missionaries are days late from a journey from Harmattan. If you have any information, please speak with Mofat in the residential area, the man with the straw hat!
Hey there! Damian Lockwell is looking for information about the recent report of criminal activity in the Marsh! If you have anything to report, please let Chamberlord Lockwell know!
Ah! [PlayerName]! Cardinal Bourlamaque at the temple wanted to see you! He said he wanted to talk to you about taking down those bandits in the marsh!

“We aren’t pleased with this arrangement either. Even with the aid of that Soroborean, there is only so much we can do with just one mage. More aid will be coming in the next few months, so be patient.”

“Instructions from the boss in Berg were clear, never let those monsters near the prison cells! They WILL slaughter the prisoners out of sheer instinct! We can't keep kidnapping more of Elatt's missionaries without risking serious consequences!”

“Your failure in that recent raid is unacceptable. There can’t be witnesses. Do you know what the Sorobor Academy does to loose ends who screw up? We risk being eliminated if our operation is discovered! Is that clear?”

“If I catch you talking to the test subjects one more time, I swear to Elatt, I will have your head. If they find out that we are trying to learn to manipulate and control them, they will slaughter us all. You’ve seen what they’ve done to the prisoners, do you want that to be us next?!”

“The human Jager Sullivan promised us he would find a way to free us from our rage towards the enemy. We must trust in him. But do not be stupid. If he does not have a solution after two full moons, leave without warning.”

“We suspect he may have other motives in mind, and the longer we stay in this marsh, under the shadow of the enemy, the greater our chances of being discovered and killed. Take no risks, my kin. We Immaculates always stand alone in this world.”

(The pieces are coming together. Someone from the Sorobor Academy is arming these bandits, but for what end you’re not quite sure. You should let someone with power in the Blue Chamber Collective know.)
(You notice a key attached to this note, it has the face of a Tuanosaur carved onto the handle.)
(At last, everything is clear. These Immaculates were working with Jager Sullivan to find a way to overcome their instinctual rage against those who bear the spirit of Elatt.)
(You should let someone with power in the Blue Chamber know. Perhaps you have even enough proof to confront Jager himself.)
(The Chamberlord of Monsoon would also probably be very interested in knowing that such a dangerous group has been operating so close to his city.)
I’ve been hearing rumors of extended criminal activity in the Hallowed Marsh area. You’ve been out there recently, correct? Can you give me a report?
There was a gang of bandits that were attacking the Holy Mission.

Oh, they were just interested in the Holy Mission? Then, frankly, what the Holy Mission does is its business. If their “god” can’t protect them from a few measly bandits, I don’t see how it’s my problem.
They were funded by Sorobor and very well armed. They could be a threat to Monsoon in the future.
Sorobor, you say? I don’t know why anyone from the Sorobor Academy would stoop to arming bandits, but even so, if they’re that well armed, they could pose a threat to my citizens.
There are Immaculates working with Sorobor soldiers in the Marsh.
Immaculates? Working with soldiers?! You’re certain? Dammit Elatt, what danger have you attracted to my city now?!

Elatt damn it all. I'll hire some more guards and mercenaries to defend Monsoon until the threat has passed. Those idiots at the temple had better appreciate what I’m doing for the city they’re squatting in!
If you want to do something about Sorobor’s involvement, you'll have better luck with someone else, preferably in Berg. There's not much I can do from here.
Nothing I couldn’t handle, the situation is dealt with.
Oh. Well, good work then. I’m in a charitable mood, so I think I can offer you a bounty for dealing with the threat.
You look like you have something to say to me. Out with it.
I know about your little experiment with the Immaculates in the Hallowed Marsh.
Pardon me? I have no idea what you're talking about. I haven’t been there in years.
You were having mercenaries kidnap Holy Mission members so you could learn to control the instinct of Immaculates.
Even assuming you're right, which you're not, what would be wrong with that? Learning to make the Immaculates into useful pawns rather than barely sentient monsters would benefit everyone.
Let's see if the Chamberlords think of this the same way. I think they'll find the evidence more than convincing enough to arrest you.

Dammit, I told those idiots to burn anything that could be used as evidence! Bah, you've got me by the stones, [PlayerName]. How much for your silence? Give me the evidence and I'll give you 100 silver and three pieces of Hackmanite.
I'll think about it.
This is the best deal that anyone can give you, I guarantee it. Don’t be a fool.
Deal. Take the evidence.
Smart move. We won't meet again, I assure you.
Move along, bum. This is private property. I’m one of Sorobor’s top financiers, and unless you’re a Chamberlord or someone with priceless artifacts for sale, I have nothing to say for you.
And if you have an attitude like that, I have nothing to say to you either.
Good. We understand one another. Off with you.
I want you to turn yourself in to Elatt’s judgment. Many of our people died because of you.
Not a snowball’s chance in summer. 100 silver and the Hackmanite, and that’s my final offer.
What can the Chamberlord of Sorobor do for you?
Do you know that one of your Soroboreans is behind kidnapping and murder?
What, who, how? I sincerely hope you have the proof to back this accusation up!
I found these letters in a cave crawling with mercenaries who were kidnapping missionaries from Monsoon. Sorobor Academy is called out by name.
I found these letters proving that Jager Sullivan was collaborating with Immaculates to kidnap and murder followers of Elatt. Thoughts?

Elatt's name... If this were to get out, the scandal would be catastrophic! Listen, I can make it worth your while if you hand them over to me. We will handle this with an internal investigation, and the guilty party will be... dealt with.
You're going to kill him?
What, you’re going to reassign him someplace cozy?
How? Give him a desk job away from anyone else?

Well, that depends on how flexible the culprit is, isn't it? The blood price that a scandal this monstrous would bring on his family would drive a considerable amount of people to murder him rather than risk the truth getting out.

Unless he wants to end up with a knife in his back, he's going to do whatever we tell him to for the very foreseeable future. He will not get off easily for what he did, believe me. Sorobor knows how to use leverage like this.
Let me think more about this.
Very well. Please, consider my offer very seriously. This choice benefits us all.
What do you say? Give me the evidence and I will deal with the one responsible. You’ll walk away with 50 silver and a high-capacity backpack.
Excellent. Remember this is our secret, alright?
What do you say? Give me the evidence and I will deal with the one responsible. You’ll walk away with 50 silver and a high-capacity backpack.
I’m listening.
Time is money, my friend. Never waste it!
Well, spit it out.
Sorobor was funding a bandit gang to kidnap and murder missionaries from the Holy Mission.
Well, well, well. Look at that. I'll handle this investigation personally and see that justice comes down hard on everyone involved. They need to be made an example of!
Hand me the evidence and I’ll give you 50 Silver and my assurance that the perpetrator will pay dearly for this. This could be a great political gift. I’d seriously owe you for this.
I don’t know who you think will get the job done better than me, but alright. As long as justice is done here, I’m satisfied.
Perfect. I’m going to enjoy bringing down the hammer on Sorobor for this. I owe you one, [PlayerName], and Sagard Battleborn always honors his debts.
Elatt's breath, this is horrendous news. I will see to it that those responsible are brought before the Chamberlords and judged to the full extent of the law.
Give me the proof, and the Blue Chamber will owe you a Tribal Favor for this, as well as a 25 silver bounty for your hard work.
I see. If you think someone else is better suited to handle this investigation, then I have no objection. As long as justice is meted out, that is all that matters to me.
Thank you, [PlayerName]. We will see to it that this never happens again. Everyone in the Collective owes you a debt of gratitude, [PlayerName]. We will not forget this.
What is it, [PlayerName]?
I want to talk about the usual stuff.
By the Scourge... I will call an immediate council meeting. This scandal must be handled swiftly and forcefully. Sorobor must answer for what they allowed to happen under their very noses.
I’m not sure what I can offer as a reward for your...Ah! I recently received a gift of a piece of Palladium. I can offer that plus 25 silver as a reward for this evidence.
As you wish. As long as justice is delivered to those who would do such harm to the Holy Mission, I suppose that is all that matters.
You've done the right thing, [PlayerName]. The Holy Mission of Elatt thanks you.
You look like something’s on your mind. What can the Chamberlord for the Holy Mission do for you?
I wish Lockwell would see reason. While it may be awkward to have two Chamberlords representing one city, The Holy Mission is an essential part of life in Aurai now. We need proper representation!
If only he’d stop seeing my position as a threat to his own... Well, all I can do is try my best.
Welcome, [PlayerName]. I wish to thank you for dealing with those who were kidnapping and bringing harm to our people.
The fact that Immaculates were hiding so close to Monsoon is troubling. They are normally intelligent enough to avoid the Hallowed Marsh entirely.
I think they were trying to find a way to break free from their instinct to attack Elatt.
Were they, now? I can only hope they someday find success, although I do not have much hope. It would benefit us all if they overcame their origins, rather than force us to destroy them.
If you need me to slaughter more of them, just let me know.
I shall, but with a heavy heart. Immaculates may be Scourge Beasts, but they can think and reason. It would benefit us all if they overcame their origins, rather than force us to destroy them.
Well done, [PlayerName]. The zeal with which you pursued justice for our fallen comrades, and with which you protected the Marsh is admirable. You have earned my blessing.
I am satisfied with your results, [PlayerName]. The crisis is over and the perpetrator will be punished. Without a definitive legal judgment, though, such a situation may arise again.
I thank you for rooting out the Immaculates and mercenaries that preyed upon our people, [PlayerName]. That is all.
Thank you, Elatt.
Wait, don’t I get a reward?
You have already received your worldly reward from Jager Sullivan. You do not deserve more than what you have already received.
(You feel Elatt’s presence dissipate like a bucket of water being poured on a flame. He is clearly disappointed in you.)
value
What in Elatt's name are you doing in here? This is private property! I’m a damn Baron for Elatt’s sake! Get out before I have you arrested!
I should be saying that. You’re an accomplice in Prince Jaden’s murder.
Oh no. They’re coming for me. I wasn’t expecting this so soon... 300 silver! I'll give you 300 silver if you just pretend you didn't see me and you just let me go!
Judging by the stench in your little “playroom” down here, you've got plenty of blood on your hands. No, this only ends one way.
Y-you'll never take me alive!
I wasn't planning to. Die, Trog spawn!
This is for that time you ripped me off and gave me a tent!
300 Silver, huh? Alright, I didn't see you.
I see someone appreciates the value of money. Thank you. We won't meet again!
Sorry, I don’t have time for chat. I’m waiting on a shipment of goods, a really big one. Can’t talk about it, it’s very hush-hush.

My men tell me we’ve caught Baron Montgomery. He tried to make a quick getaway into the slums for supplies before fleeing Levant and basically ran right into our arms. We’ll see to it that he gets what he deserves.

You also killed Baron Montgomery, I hear. I won’t ask for the details. As far as I’m concerned, the number of corpses in that torture room more than merits his death. I’ll report you killing him as self-defense and leave it at that. Good work.
My men will take Pietro into custody, [PlayerName]. The Heroic Kingdom is in your debt. I will personally report your impact to King Simeon himself, and see to it that he rewards you adequately.
You have something about the murder of Prince Jaden? Don’t just stand there, spill it!
I’ve found some evidence about the plot, I think you’ll want to see this.
Sorry, I don’t have anything you don’t already know.

Hmm... I appreciate the evidence you have, but there’s not enough for me to move on this. I’m doing my own investigation and not everything lines up yet. If you find some more, please report back to me immediately.
This is... I can’t avoid this conclusion any longer. The way this lines up with my own investigation... Prince Pietro, what in Elatt’s name were you thinking?
Based on what we’ve found, it seems like Prince Pietro has been plotting a coup against King Simeon and Queen Calixa, and that he masterminded the attack on Berg as well.
Not to mention he’s been making use of that damned smuggler’s tunnel under the slums that Baron Montgomery got built.
We need to move on the pair of them. I have a squadron of troops ready to go, but I could use the extra help. Are you ready to go now?
Yes, I’m ready to come along, where are we going?
No thanks. I think I’ll let you handle this, Cyrene.

We’re going to flush them out of that smuggler’s tunnel. You and I will go in from the Baron’s manor, I’ll have Yzan hold down the Palace side entrance, and my troops will cover the slums exit and the desert exit. Come on, let’s roll.
Very well. Yzan and I will handle this on our own, then. Come back if you change your mind, and maybe we’ll still have some way for you to help.
I want to talk about the murdered prince.
Let’s talk about the usual stuff, Cyrene.

Alright, we’ve blocked off the other exits. Let’s split up and take this area cleanly. Keep your eyes peeled for the Prince Pietro, and the Baron. We don’t want either of them to risk slipping through our fingers.
Gladly. For the record, I’m sorry it turned out this way Pietro. You’re not who I thought you were. As for you, [PlayerName], good work.
GAH! You startled me! Who are you, what do you want?
Uh... Nothing? What are you doing out here?
N-Nothing! Nothing at all! Leave me alone!
So you're the supposed assassin of Prince Jaden, I take it. You don't look like a priest of Elatt.

Y-yeah- I mean no- I mean... They set me up, alright! They gave me a big sack of coins to run straight down the main street of Levant in this getup. Then I heard "Stop him! He killed Prince Jaden", and I knew I had to get as far away from the city as I could! I’m just a puppet, I swear!

I know I should probably head back to the meetup point, but considering they're willing to murder a prince I'm freaked out that they might kill me just to keep me quiet! I can't stay out here forever, but I'm scared to go back!
Where’s the meetup point, exactly?

Near the giant insect hives, there’s this old prison in a cave. I know some bandits sometimes used to use it to stash goods or people they want to get rid of. My contact used that place for us to meet up!
There might be some goods or information or something there, go and help yourself to it or anything else in the damn place.
Wait, you're just telling me up-front?
I... I kinda just feel like my odds of survival improve a whole bunch if someone tough looking, like you, goes there first and, you know, take out anything nasty over there.
Who was giving the orders? Who killed the prince?

I don't know, the guys all had masks on and nobody used their real name. I thought this was just a distraction for a robbery or something, I didn't think someone, let alone Prince Jaden would end up dead, I swear!
You should probably turn yourself in.

I'm not risking a life sentence in that cell in the slums! Not to mention whoever organized this mess would put me on their short list for a very bloody accident if I ran my mouth! I'm not going back to Levant, no way, no how!
(This man appears to have been shot in the back... He has several rotting insect husks in his pocket. Maybe he came from a place where insects hide?)
I won’t resist, I’m not stupid. Take me in, Cyrene.
Alright, you both have me. I know when I'm beaten. I'll surrender.
Just like that?

Do I look like I can stand a chance against the two of you, cornered down here by the army? I have a far better chance of survival if I throw myself on the mercy of my parents, even if I was planning to kill them both.
Why would you do this?

My parents have grown soft. Old Levant is an existential threat to us, and still they want to welcome their people to join us! And they still treat the Blue Chamber Collective like equals! We were not elected by simple humans, we were anointed kings and queens by a GOD!

My brother was too nosy, he would have found out about my plot to kill Calixa and Simeon eventually. And I needed to be secure in the knowledge that I would be the only true heir to Levant's throne. It was nothing personal.
If you want to live, I hope you're willing to rat out your followers.

Never. I won't let those who pledged their loyalty to me die for nothing. It's the least I can do for those who came this far for me. I may just be a murderer to you, but I have principles. I’d rather die than betray them.
You're going to come with me and not make a fuss, you hear me?
I hope they feed you to the assassin bugs out there.
You're lucky you're worth more alive. I'd kill you myself.
Prince Jaden, murdered! I don't believe it! He used to come here all the time! Our eyes even met while I was dancing!
Yes, they found him dead in a chair in his room with a leather band wrapped tight around his neck. Whoever killed him pulled so hard it was bleeding! He may as well have slit Prince Jaden's throat!
Oh please, don't describe it! Have they caught the killer yet? I need to know there’s still justice in this world!

The news just broke, Lysia! No, they haven’t caught the bastard yet! But my money's on that priest of Elatt who was seen sprinting out of the palace right about the time the Queen found the body. Last I heard, he'd fled into the desert!
Wait... Him? I saw that man! He was wearing orange and white robes and looked scared half to death as he ran past! Dammit, if only I'd stopped him!

What are you talking about? The Holy Mission robes are white and gold! Anyway, point is, he either has to come back here and face his due justice, or he'll be feeding the vultures with his own flesh the moment he runs out of water.
You're terribly morbid, Sandrea! But for a prince-killer, I'll gladly hope he suffers for what he did!
You're serious? The youngest prince of Levant, murdered?
The Queen found Prince Jaden dead in a chair in his room, strangled from behind by a leather strap. Levant is in a complete uproar over the assassination!
Who killed him? Has anyone claimed responsibility?
No one. But they did see a priest of Elatt fleeing the palace and into the desert around the time the prince was killed. That's their prime suspect at this point.
A priest from the Holy Mission? Murdering a prince? That doesn't seem right. The Holy Mission is politically neutral, all they care about is protecting Aurai from the Scourge!
True. This brings to mind two possibilities. Either the real killer wants to frame the Holy Mission, or the Royal Family of Levant is trying to bargain with the Scourge.
Elatt's breath, I can only hope it's the former. Hopefully the truth will come out when they find that fleeing priest.
I doubt they'll find him. Abrassar desert is huge, and no matter how much Elatt favors you, if you don't find water out there within a few days, you're going to drop dead.

“This is the last delivery for awhile, Pigeoneye. The Baron is muscling us out of the smuggler's tunnel. He's moving loads of weapons and personnel in and out frequently. I don’t know who he’s working for, but he’s got Levant city guards on his side now.”

“I overheard one of the guards say something about reporting to “his boss” in the Hive Prison that the Corsairs sometimes use for interrogations. I’m not sure if he knows who uses that place or not. Either way, it’s signs of serious trouble coming.”

“Our lord has made his move. Deal with the Old Levant problem swiftly, and keep attention on Enmerkar for as long as possible. The less people watching the boss, the better. Maybe soon we'll be calling him Your Majesty!”

“Keep this information away from The Snake. Her loyalties may not align with ours. Do not take any chances just because she was involved in this operation. I doubt she would approve if she realized our lord was responsible for Prince Jaden’s murder.”
“Send word to keep an eye on the Levant Slums back home. I worry that some of the people there know what we’re using the smuggling tunnel for. Crack down on any known information peddlers.”

“The operation was a moderate success. Prince Jaden is dead, but the queen is suspicious that our fall guy isn't the one responsible. Please note for the record that I thought disguising him as a member of the Holy Mission was a stupid idea.”
“I've heard he's run off into the desert after the murder. If you find him, or he returns to the base, shoot him. We can't have loose ends running around who aren't fully committed to this plan.”

“It may be months before we are ready for our final strike. Our lord does not believe our coup will succeed without either mass public support or the support of the majority of the army. We must redouble our efforts to make that happen.”

“There’s a lot resting on the shoulders of our guys in the Burnt Outpost in Enmerkar. If they fail, there may end up being a lot of pressure on us out here. We need Old Levant to get the message. We. Don’t. Negotiate. With. THEM.”
(The evidence of a plot within Levant is mounting. You should turn in these documents to someone from the Levant Military.)
(The evidence of a plot within Levant is mounting. Cyrene would be very interested in this information the next time you’re in Levant)
Well, the master sleuth appears!

Not to mention he was planning to kill us both the moment he had a chance! There are few things I can't forgive, and harm to my wife is one of them! I'm ashamed that he shares my blood. We raised him to be better than this.

I hear that you played a pivotal role in cracking this conspiracy, [PlayerName]. I'd like to grant you Baron Montgomery's manor as a reward for your actions. You deserve a little luxury after all you've done!
Cyrene tells me that you gave her the information she needed to solve this case, [PlayerName]. Thank you for your efforts.
We might well owe you our lives, [PlayerName]. You’re always welcome here in the Heroic Kingdom.
Now that Baron Montgomery is behind bars, his house will be put up for sale. If you want it, you’ll get preferential treatment. Pay the servant outside the manor, and it’s all yours.
Go see the servant standing around outside the manor, and they’ll give you the key to your new home. Enjoy it, [PlayerName]!
Cyrene told us about your work bringing down Pietro's plot against us. Thank you for bringing his terrible ambitions to an end.
What will happen to Prince Pietro now?
An example must be made of him. That's what the firing squad is for. It breaks my heart, but... I must put the good of Levant above my feelings. He cannot be allowed to live after what he’s done.

Without an heir, the succession of Levant is thrown into chaos. There will surely be more opportunists who will try to position themselves to claim Levant the moment one of us is gone. Things will be difficult for the forseeable future.
What about the Baron?
I wish you could have taken him alive, but from what I understand, you acted in self-defense. I would have preferred to question him for his sources, but he’s less dangerous dead than free.

We had troops waiting at every entrance to those tunnels, he didn't get far. Because he has decided to co-operate with the investigation, we will spare his life. He will spend the rest of it in an open-air cell in the slums, however long he can survive that open heat.
It appears he was putting pressure on many of our merchants as well. With the Baron out of the picture, I'm certain their prices will return to normal.
You look like you’ve been around. Spare a few silver, mate? The people here need all the help they can get.
Here, I can give you 40 silver.
Sorry, I’ve got nothing for you.
Thank you. Your kindness will not be forgotten. I’ll see that this goes where it’s needed.
If you’ve got some more silver to spare, we could really use the help.
You’ve really helped us out. I’d like to return the favor to you. I help organize some of the smuggling of necessary goods into the slums. I’d like you to have some of our last shipment.
(Pigeoneye puts two fingers up to his lips and lets out a distinctive whistle. A moment later, he receives a whistle in response)
I’ve got one of my boys to open up the stash for you. Head over to the training area near the Rogue Trainer. You’ll find that the small alley there has been opened up to you.
It’s mostly weapons and things that remained in the last shipment. Feel free to help yourself to anything that’s in there. And... seriously, thank you. From all of us here in the slums.
Fair enough. You’ve got your own problems to deal with.
The next time you come to Levant, we’ll have opened the passage to Tamara’s shop. She’s right here in the slums and sells rare weapons and monster parts. At an insane price, though! Ha!
